intro: Haumaniastrum sericeum, commonly known as the silky sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has silvery, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Haumaniastrum sericeum is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native range.
